model_solution:
Step 1: Simplify the square root of 27 in the denominator.
$\frac{3}{\sqrt{27}}=\frac{3}{\sqrt{9 \times 3}}=\frac{3}{3\sqrt{3}}$
Step 2: 
$\frac{3}{3\sqrt{3}}$
$\frac{3}{3\sqrt{3}}=\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}$
$\frac{1}{\sqrt{3}}=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}$
$\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}$
$\frac{\sqrt{3}}{3}$
